body:
Hey @erichmenge .. I thought about this solution at first, but decided to try a different path, to use the first available column type from the result, as we should always get only one type back:

```diff
# calculations
-      types  = result.column_types.merge klass.column_types
-      column = types[key]
+      column = klass.column_types[key] || result.column_types.values.first
 
       result.map do |attributes|
         raise ArgumentError, "Pluck expects to select just one attribute: #{attributes.
-        value = klass.initialize_attributes(attributes).first[1]
+        value = klass.initialize_attributes(attributes).values.first
         if column
           column.type_cast value
         else


# test
   def test_pluck_with_selection_clause
     assert_equal [50, 53, 55, 60], Account.pluck('DISTINCT credit_limit').sort
+    assert_equal [50, 53, 55, 60], Account.pluck('DISTINCT accounts.credit_limit').sort
+    assert_equal [50, 53, 55, 60], Account.pluck('DISTINCT(credit_limit)').sort
+    assert_equal [50 + 53 + 55 + 60], Account.pluck('SUM(DISTINCT(credit_limit))')
```

I added your test line as well, everything seems fine with these changes, and we're covering more possibilities. Can you update your pull request accordingly? I'll merge it then, thanks!
